Package server

Class ScheduleAdmin

java.lang.Object
server.ScheduleAdmin
public class ScheduleAdmin
extends java.lang.Object
The ScheduleAdmin contains methods which interacts with the server and database when working with the Schedule Table. Methods querying, creation, editing and deletion of schedules from the Schedule table. This class file contains both method that interacts with the server and database, and the SQL queries.

  • Method Details

    • createScheduleTable

      public static java.lang.String createScheduleTable() throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      Ensures that the ScheduleTable is created inside the database. The method should be called when the server is being set up to ensure the Schedule Table exists if it is not in the database.

      This method always returns immediately. It will either return a success message "Schedule Table Created", or further information such as Schedule Table exists with/without data pre-populated inside

      Returns:
      A String which specifies if the Schedule Table exists within the Database.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • dropScheduleTable

      public static java.lang.String dropScheduleTable() throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function will drop the Schedule Table if required. No checks are done. This function is not linked to any functionality however is made during testing processes.

      This method always returns immediately. It will either return a success message "Schedule Table Dropped", or throw an SQLException error as the method was unable to be completed

      Returns:
      A String that specifies if the Schedule Table has been dropped, if it existed.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • deleteAllSchedules

      public static java.lang.String deleteAllSchedules() throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function will delete the Schedule Table Data if required. No checks are done.

      This method always returns immediately. It will either return a success message "Schedule Table Dropped", or a fail message if it dosent run

      Returns:
      A String which specifies if the Schedule Table Data has been deleted, if it existed.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • deleteSchedule

      public static Server.ServerAcknowledge deleteSchedule​(java.lang.String sessionToken, java.lang.String billboard) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function will delete a specific data in the Schedule Table. THe billboard that is to be deleted will be specified in the billboard parameter

      This method always returns immediately. It will either return a success message or fail message if no deletion can be done.

      Parameters:
      sessionToken - A String which is the session token from the calling user.
      billboard - A String which is the name of the billboard to have its schedule deleted.
      Returns:
      Server acknowledgment for success or to indicate whether some other exception occurred (BillboardNotExists, ScheduleExists, InsufficientPermission).
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • listScheduleInformation

      public static ScheduleList listScheduleInformation() throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function will list Schedules for billboards. This will only show the raw schedules with no additional computation for repeats.

      This method always returns immediately. It will either return a success message or fail message if there is nothing to return for billboard schedules

      Returns:
      Returns a ScheduleList object which contains information on all fields. Each field is an array and can be read via getters.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • updateSchedule

      public static Server.ServerAcknowledge updateSchedule​(java.lang.String sessionToken, java.lang.String billboard, java.lang.String StartTime, java.lang.String Duration, java.lang.String CreationDateTime, java.lang.String Repeat, java.lang.String Sunday, java.lang.String Monday, java.lang.String Tuesday, java.lang.String Wednesday, java.lang.String Thursday, java.lang.String Friday, java.lang.String Saturday) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function will update existing Schedules inside the Data Table. Each parameter for the function are fed in through the Control Panel and can be assumed to be valid.

      This method always returns immediately, and will return a relevant string noting if there is any errors or if the schedule gets edited successfully.

      Parameters:
      sessionToken - A String which is the session token from the calling user.
      billboard - A String which provides Billboard Name to search in the data table for updating
      StartTime - A String in format of Java Time to store into database
      Duration - A String representing an integer which provides Duration which to store into database
      CreationDateTime - A String in format of DateTime which provides CreationDateTime to store into database
      Repeat - A String representing an integer how often the schedule is repeated (in minutes)
      Sunday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Sunday
      Monday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Monday
      Tuesday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Tuesday
      Wednesday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Wednesday
      Thursday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Thursday
      Friday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Friday
      Saturday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Saturday
      Returns:
      Returns a String which specifies whether or not the Schedule was created successfully or failed due to reasons.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • getScheduleInformation

      public static ScheduleInfo getScheduleInformation​(java.lang.String sessionToken, java.lang.String BillboardName) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function will list Schedules for billboards for a specific day. The day parameter is parsed into as a string and filters results to display raw schedules for the day.

      This method always returns immediately. It will either return a success message or fail message if there is nothing to return for billboard schedules.

      Parameters:
      sessionToken - A String which specifies the session token to ensure the user has the correct permissions.
      BillboardName - A String to feed in to filter SQL quiries to return only schedules for a specifc Billboard.
      Returns:
      Returns a ScheduleInfo object which contains information on all fields. Each field is an array and can be read via getters.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • scheduleAllDayCP

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>> scheduleAllDayCP​(java.lang.String sessionToken, java.lang.String day) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function will list all Schedules for billboards for a specific day. The day parameter is parsed into as a string and filters results to display raw schedules for the day and then the resultant object is then imputed for time. This function builds on listFilteredScheduleInformation and viewAllDaySchedule methods, and is called by control panel to server.

      This method always returns immediately. It will either return a success message or fail message if there is nothing to return for billboard schedules.

      Parameters:
      sessionToken - A String which specifies the session token to ensure the user has the correct permissions.
      day - A String to feed in to filter SQL quiries to return only schedules for a specifc day.
      Returns:
      Returns a ScheduleList object which contains information on all fields. Each field is an array and can be read via getters.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • listAllFilteredScheduleInformation

      public static ScheduleList listAllFilteredScheduleInformation​(java.lang.String sessionToken, java.lang.String day) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function will list all Schedules for billboards for a specific day. The day parameter is parsed into as a string and filters results to display raw schedules for the day and then the resultant object is then imputed for time. This function builds on listFilteredScheduleInformation and viewAllDaySchedule methods, and is called by control panel to server

      This method always returns immediately. It will either return a success message or fail message if there is nothing to return for billboard schedules

    • listFilteredScheduleInformation

      public static ScheduleList listFilteredScheduleInformation​(java.lang.String day) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function will list Schedules for billboards for a specific day. The day parameter is parsed into as a string and filters results to display raw schedules for the day.

      This method always returns immediately. It will either return a success message or fail message if there is nothing to return for billboard schedules

    • viewAllDaySchedule

      public static ScheduleList viewAllDaySchedule​(ScheduleList scheduleList) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function will calculate all possible Schedules for billboards for a specific day with repeat. The scheduleList Parameter will feed in raw schedules into the function to compute additional schedules for the day.

      This method always returns immediately. It will either return a ScheduleList object listing all possible schedules from the given list.

      Parameters:
      scheduleList - A ScheduleList object to be imputed for all additional schedules
      Returns:
      Returns a ScheduleList object with imputed results for schedules. Contains information on all fields. Each field is an array and can be read via getters.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • viewCurrentSchedule

      public static CurrentSchedule viewCurrentSchedule​(ScheduleList allDaySchedule, java.time.LocalTime currentTime) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function will calculate if there is any current schedule active. The function takes in an ScheduleList object generated from the allDaySchedule Function and also a LocalTime object that notes the currentTime.

      This method always returns immediately. It will either return a ScheduleList object listing with all possible active schedules, or it will return a empty object with a Fail String.

      Parameters:
      allDaySchedule - A ScheduleList object from allDaySchedule for calculating active schedules
      currentTime - A LocalTime object which notes the current time of request
      Returns:
      Returns a CurrentSchedule object noting any active schedules. Each field is an array and can be read via getters.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • latestDateTimeInArray

      public static int latestDateTimeInArray​(java.util.ArrayList<java.time.LocalDateTime> dateTimes)
      This function returns the index of the latest date from an array of LocalDateTime values.
      Parameters:
      dateTimes - An ArrayList of LocalDateTime values.
      Returns:
      index Returns an int which is the index of the latest date in the dateTimes ArrayList.

    • activeBillboardDisplay

      public static DbBillboard activeBillboardDisplay() throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function calculates the current billboard that needs to be displayed, and returns a DbBillboard objects for the current billboard.
      Returns:
      Returns a DbBillboard object for the current billboard to be displayed.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • createScheduleSQL

      public static void createScheduleSQL​(java.lang.String billboard, java.lang.String StartTime, java.lang.String Duration, java.lang.String CreationDateTime, java.lang.String Repeat, java.lang.String Sunday, java.lang.String Monday, java.lang.String Tuesday, java.lang.String Wednesday, java.lang.String Thursday, java.lang.String Friday, java.lang.String Saturday) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function creates the schedule in the database.
      Parameters:
      billboard - A String which provides Billboard Name to search in the data table for updating
      StartTime - A String in format of Java Time to store into database
      Duration - A String representing an integer which provides Duration which to store into database
      CreationDateTime - A String in format of DateTime which provides CreationDateTime to store into database
      Repeat - A String representing an integer how often the schedule is repeated (in minutes)
      Sunday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Sunday
      Monday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Monday
      Tuesday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Tuesday
      Wednesday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Wednesday
      Thursday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Thursday
      Friday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Friday
      Saturday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Saturday
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • updateScheduleSQL

      public static void updateScheduleSQL​(java.lang.String billboard, java.lang.String StartTime, java.lang.String Duration, java.lang.String CreationDateTime, java.lang.String Repeat, java.lang.String Sunday, java.lang.String Monday, java.lang.String Tuesday, java.lang.String Wednesday, java.lang.String Thursday, java.lang.String Friday, java.lang.String Saturday) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function updates the schedule in the database.
      Parameters:
      billboard - A String which provides Billboard Name to search in the data table for updating
      StartTime - A String in format of Java Time to store into database
      Duration - A String representing an integer which provides Duration which to store into database
      CreationDateTime - A String in format of DateTime which provides CreationDateTime to store into database
      Repeat - A String representing an integer how often the schedule is repeated (in minutes)
      Sunday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Sunday
      Monday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Monday
      Tuesday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Tuesday
      Wednesday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Wednesday
      Thursday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Thursday
      Friday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Friday
      Saturday - A String that's either 1 or 0 to see if the schedule is to be run during Saturday
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.

    • countFilterScheduleSql

      public static java.lang.String countFilterScheduleSql​(java.lang.String billboard) throws java.io.IOException, java.sql.SQLException
      This function counts a Schedule for a specific billboard from the database.
      Parameters:
      billboard - A string billboard name to be searched for in the Schedule table.
      Returns:
      A String which specifies the number of times a billboard is displayed.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Throws an exception if an I/O exception of some sort has occurred.
      java.sql.SQLException - Throws an exception if there is a database access error or other errors.
